Module sims.custpoint
Package sims.custpoint.controller

Class AppointmentController

java.lang.Object
sims.custpoint.controller.AppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
A class responsible for handling logic within the Appointment screen. Consists of parsing forms for updating or adding new appointments, empty field checks, logic checks, time checks, addition/update to the database, and routing back to the main menu.

  • Constructor Details

    • AppointmentController

      public AppointmentController()

  • Method Details

    • isNotOverlappingAppointment

      private boolean isNotOverlappingAppointment(int customerID, LocalDateTime newAppStart, LocalDateTime newAppEnd)
      A method for verifying whether a customer's proposed appointment time overlaps with an existing appointment time based on five identified conditions.
      Parameters:
      customerID - The customer who is avoiding an overlap of appointment times.
      newAppStart - The proposed new appointment's start time.
      newAppEnd - The proposed new appointment's end time.
      Returns:
      A boolean representing that the given appointment does not overlap with any previous entries.

    • populateTimeFields

      private void populateTimeFields()
      Generates times between 8AM EST and 10PM EST to be viewed by the user in their local time. The items are then saved to the ObservableList objects holding start and end times. Taken in part from Mark Kinkead lecture.

    • populateComboBoxes

      private void populateComboBoxes()
      Executes the method for creating/adding all time entries to their ComboBox elements, as well as setting users, contacts, and customer ComboBox values.

    • onClickCancelButton

      private void onClickCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Exits the add/update process and reroutes the user to the main menu screen upon.
      Parameters:
      e - THe button click action event on the Cancel button.

    • setFields

      private void setFields()
      LAMBDA: Instead of creating a for-each loop to select the combo boxes for the modified items values, I was able to run a filtered stream and set it to the first (and only) item returned.. Sets the starting fields and labels for the screen depending on if the action is to be adding or updating an appointment.

    • onChangeAppointmentTime

      private void onChangeAppointmentTime(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      A method to continuously ensure selected appointment times meet both temporal and customer overlap logic.
      Parameters:
      e - The combo box the action has come from, either the start time or end time.

    • parseDates

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<LocalDateTime> parseDates()
      Takes the text fields representing the day and hour/minute and turns them into LocalDateTime objects. In the case that the appointment goes over 24:00 hours on a day, also adds one to the end date.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList object containing parsed LocalDateTime appointment start and end times.

    • onClickSubmitButton

      private void onClickSubmitButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Upon clicking submission, the application will verify that all fields were filled out. If so, it will then parse data from the fields. If this is a new appointment, a new entry will be added into the database. Otherwise, an existing entry will be altered.
      Parameters:
      e - THe button click action event on the Submit button.

    • allFieldsEntered

      private boolean allFieldsEntered()
      A method that checks each field to ensure that data has been written to it as no appointment field can contain empty data. Returns a boolean based on all fields passing.
      Returns:
      A boolean marking that the validation checks passed.

    • receivePassedAppointment

      public static void receivePassedAppointment(Appointment appointment)
      Sets an Appointment object to the class that is received from the Main Menu view.
      Parameters:
      appointment - The part to be modified.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
